intro: Talauma sambuensis, commonly known as the Sambu talauma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth surface and a waxy coating. Talauma sambuensis is often found in the undergrowth of humid, shaded environments where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils.
